summary: The Armed Police Force (APF) and India’s Sasastra Seema Bal (SSB) on Saturday launched hotline telephone number, 1114, to handle complaints against harassments by security personnel and other grievances in both sides of the Nepal-India border. Those who think they are harassed by security personnel at the border can lodge their complaints through the hotline service at the APF headquarters or regional offices, the APF said. APF will look into the cases in Nepali side while SSB will take up the case in India,” he said. A meeting of APF SSB officials in  Kathmandu  some three weeks ago took the decision on the hotline service.
title: apf-ssb-launch-hotline-service
